description: Proven TikTok slideshow formats with structures, hooks, and best practices. Used by Creative Director agent to select optimal format for each project.

formats.name: Transformation Story
formats.description: Personal narrative showing a before/after journey. The viewer follows a character through struggle to success.
when_to_use: When you have a relatable problem the product solves

structure.guidance: First-person story entry. Start with 'I', 'My', 'When I'. Create tension or curiosity.
Expand on the pain point. Make it deeply relatable. Show the struggle.
Optional: Show what didn't work. Builds credibility and relatability.
The turning point. What changed. Product mention if natural - framed as incidental discovery.
Results and new state. Emotional payoff. Show the 'after'.
Engagement-first: 'Save this', 'What's your story?', 'Comment below'. NOT 'Download now'.

formats.product_position_guidance: Mention product in slide 4 as part of the discovery, framed as 'by the way, this helped' or 'I found this'. Never lead with product.
example_hooks: I was skeptical until I tried it for 30 days
Nobody warned me this would happen
I never thought I'd say this but...
I was broke 2 years ago. Here's what changed everything...
My biggest mistake cost me $50k. Don't make the same one...
The day I realized I was the problem...
avoid: Explaining the product before showing the journey

formats.name: Myth-Busting / Contrarian
formats.description: Challenge common beliefs or expose what 'everyone gets wrong'. Positions the brand as an authority.
when_to_use: Contrarian takes that challenge industry norms
When you have insider knowledge to share

structure.guidance: Challenge a common belief. 'Everyone thinks X. They're wrong.' Create cognitive dissonance.
Explain what most people believe or do wrong.
Reveal the surprising truth. Use specific data or examples if possible.
Back it up. Why this works. Product can be introduced as 'the right way'.
Invite debate or saves. 'Agree or disagree?', 'Save this before you make this mistake'.

formats.product_position_guidance: Position product as 'the solution' after exposing the problem. Product represents 'what actually works'.
example_hooks: Everything you know about productivity is wrong...
The worst advice that everyone follows...
Why working harder is making you poorer...
Stop doing this. It's ruining your [X]...
Your [industry expert] lied to you about this...
Most affirmations are useless. Here's how to make them work...

formats.name: Listicle / Tips
formats.description: Numbered tips, signs, or items. Easy to consume, highly saveable content.
when_to_use: Content that should be saved for later

structure.guidance: Number + promise. '5 signs you're...', '3 things that will...'. Add intrigue with '(most people miss #3)'.
First tip/sign. Start with the most relatable or surprising one.
Second tip/sign. Build momentum.
Third tip/sign. This is often where product fits naturally.
Save prompt or question. 'Save this for later', 'Which one surprised you?'

formats.product_position_guidance: Product can be one of the tips, or the tool that enables one of the tips. Frame as 'One thing that helps with this is...'
example_hooks: 7 signs you're about to be successful (most people miss #5)
I tried 15 morning routines. Here are the only 3 that worked...
3 words that will change how people see you...
5 things I wish I knew before [X]...
The 3 biggest mistakes everyone makes with [X]...

formats.name: POV / Scenario
formats.description: Relatable scenarios framed as 'POV'. Advice disguised as entertainment. Defenses are down.
when_to_use: When you want to give advice without being preachy

structure.guidance: POV: [relatable scenario]. Make viewer immediately say 'that's me'.
Expand on the scenario. Add specific, relatable details.
The payoff. How the scenario resolves. Product fits naturally here.
Engagement question. 'Tell me you relate', 'Tag someone who does this'.

formats.product_position_guidance: Product appears as the natural solution to the relatable scenario. 'POV: you finally found [product category]' or product solves the scenario's problem.
example_hooks: POV: you figured out how to not pay a fortune for drinks at festivals
POV: You don't feel like cooking, but still want a home-cooked meal
POV: you finally stopped doom scrolling and started [positive action]
POV: it's Sunday night and you actually feel prepared for Monday
POV: you stopped explaining yourself to people who don't get it

formats.name: Secret / Insider Knowledge
formats.description: Promise exclusive or hidden information. Triggers fear of missing out and curiosity.
when_to_use: When you have genuine insider knowledge

structure.guidance: Promise forbidden or exclusive knowledge. 'What [authority] doesn't want you to know...'
Set up why this is hidden or unknown. Build intrigue.
The secret itself. Make it genuinely valuable.
How to use this knowledge. Product can fit as 'how I apply this'.
Save for later or follow for more secrets. 'More insider tips on my page'.

formats.product_position_guidance: Product is what allows you to apply the secret knowledge. 'The tool I use for this is...' or 'This is why I started using...'
example_hooks: What rich people know that you don't...
The algorithm change TikTok doesn't want you to know...
Industry secret: This is how we really make money...
I'm not allowed to share this but my [expert] friend revealed...
The supplement industry doesn't want you to know this...

formats.name: Before / After
formats.description: Visual transformation with minimal text. Perfect for products with visible results.
when_to_use: When visuals speak louder than words

structure.guidance: Tease the transformation. 'What 30 days did to my [X]' or just 'Before'.
The 'before' state. Let the visual do the work. Minimal text.
Optional: What you did. Product mention fits here.
The transformation. 'After' with stunning visual proof.
Results-focused CTA. 'Want the same results?', 'Save for your transformation'.

formats.product_position_guidance: Product is the catalyst for transformation. Can be more direct since proof is visual. 'This is what [product] did for me'.
example_hooks: 3 years of back progress in 30 seconds
What 60 days of [X] did to my [Y]
My skin before vs after using [approach]
Same person. Different mindset. Here's what changed.

formats.name: Problem-Solution
formats.description: Start with a pain point, deliver the solution. Classic marketing structure adapted for TikTok.
when_to_use: When the pain point is highly relatable

structure.guidance: Call out the problem. 'If you struggle with [X], stop scrolling'. Qualify your audience.
Make the problem vivid and relatable. Add specific details.
Introduce the approach or solution. 'Here's what actually works...'
The how. Product fits as part of the solution. Be specific.
Action-oriented. 'Try this today', 'Save and share with someone who needs this'.

formats.product_position_guidance: Product IS the solution or a key part of it. More direct positioning is acceptable because you've established the problem first.
example_hooks: If you're struggling to get followers, here's what you're doing wrong...
Still getting rejected? These 3 changes will fix that...
Your business isn't growing because you're missing this...
Tired of [problem]? I found something that actually works...
If you've ever secretly [relatable specific action], this is for you
avoid: Making the problem feel too heavy/depressing

hook_formulas.description: Universal hook formulas that work across formats

formulas.name: If This, Then That
formulas.template: If you want [desired outcome], then [specific action]
formulas.example: If you want clearer skin, stop doing this one thing

formulas.name: Everyone Does This Wrong
formulas.example: Everyone thinks affirmations are about words. They're about frequency.

formulas.name: Before/After Formula
formulas.template: I used to [struggle], now I [success] - here's how
formulas.example: I used to overthink everything. Now I trust myself. Here's what changed.

formulas.name: What Nobody Tells You
formulas.template: What [authority figures] don't tell you about [topic]
formulas.example: What therapists don't tell you about anxiety

formulas.name: The Contradiction
formulas.example: Terrified? Absolutely. Ready? Not really. Worth it? 100%.

formulas.name: Specific Timeframe
formulas.example: 3 years of personal growth in 30 seconds

formulas.name: Hyper-Specific Callout
formulas.template: If you've ever [very specific relatable action], this is for you
formulas.example: If you've ever secretly unbuttoned your jeans at dinner and hoped no one noticed - this is for you

cta_styles.description: Call-to-action approaches ranked by engagement potential

styles.description: Prioritizes saves, comments, shares over direct conversion
examples: Tag someone who needs to hear this
Share this with a friend going through it
styles.when_to_use: Default for awareness content. Builds algorithm favor and organic reach.

examples: I share tips like this every day
More on my journey in my other posts
styles.when_to_use: When building account following is the goal.

examples: Link in bio to try it
Check out [product] - it changed everything for me
styles.when_to_use: Only after story/value is established. Use sparingly. Better for warm audiences.

image_arc_definitions.moody: Dark, cinematic, tension-building. Use for problem/struggle slides.
image_arc_definitions.transitional: Neutral, bridge between moody and bright. The turning point.
image_arc_definitions.bright: Light, aspirational, hopeful. Use for solution/transformation slides.
image_arc_definitions.bold: High contrast, attention-grabbing. Use for hook slides.
image_arc_definitions.lifestyle: Relatable, everyday scenarios. Use for POV content.
image_arc_definitions.mysterious: Intriguing, shadowy. Use for secret/insider content.
image_arc_definitions.consistent: Same visual style throughout. Use for listicles.

incidental.description: Product is mentioned as a 'by the way' discovery
phrases: By the way, what helped was...

authority.description: Product represents 'what actually works' after exposing problems
phrases: The right way to do this is...

embedded.description: Product is woven into tips/list as one of the items
phrases: One tool that helps with this...
Something I use daily for this...
embedded.slide_position: As one of the list items

solution.description: Product is the answer to the established problem
phrases: This is what actually solved it...

direct.description: Product is front and center (use only with visual proof)

universal_principles: First slide is everything - you have 3 seconds to stop the scroll
Entertainment value > promotional value. TikTok is not an ad platform.
Specificity creates credibility. 'I tried 15 routines' > 'I tried many routines'
Personal stories outperform teaching. 'I learned' > 'You should know'
Visual consistency across slides creates professional feel
3-7 slides is optimal. Under 3 feels thin, over 7 causes drop-off.
Use trending audio when it fits naturally. Don't force it.
Images can outperform video - 81% higher engagement in recent studies
Long captions (bio text) can get 3x more views - use them for context
